Acetaminophen.name: Acetaminophen
Acetaminophen.description: Pain reliever and fever reducer, used for mild to moderate pain.

Ibuprofen.name: Ibuprofen
Ibuprofen.description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and reduce fever.

Naproxen.name: Naproxen
Naproxen.description: A long-acting anti-inflammatory medication commonly used for joint, muscle, and arthritis pain relief.

Aspirin.name: Aspirin
Aspirin.description: An NSAID that relieves pain and inflammation while also thinning the blood to reduce clot formation.

Caffeine.name: Caffeine
Caffeine.description: A stimulant that increases alertness and enhances the effectiveness of certain pain-relieving medications.

Cetirizine.name: Cetirizine
Cetirizine.description: A second-generation antihistamine that reduces allergy symptoms by blocking histamine with minimal sedation.

Loratadine.name: Loratadine
Loratadine.description: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes by blocking histamine.

Diphenhydramine.name: Diphenhydramine
Diphenhydramine.description: A first-generation antihistamine that treats allergies and causes sedation by crossing the blood-brain barrier.

Guaifenesin.name: Guaifenesin
Guaifenesin.description: An expectorant that loosens mucus in the airways, making coughs more productive and breathing easier.

Dextromethorphan.name: Dextromethorphan
Dextromethorphan.description: A cough suppressant that acts on the brain to reduce the urge to cough.

Phenylephrine.name: Phenylephrine
Phenylephrine.description: Phenylephrine is a decongestant. It shrinks blood vessels in the nasal passages, relieving nasal stuffiness and congestion.

Doxylamine.name: Doxylamine
Doxylamine.description: An antihistamine commonly used in nighttime medications due to its strong sedative effects.

Pseudoephedrine.name: Pseudoephedrine
Pseudoephedrine.description: A stimulant decongestant that relieves sinus pressure by shrinking swollen nasal blood vessels.

Bismuth subsalicylate.name: Bismuth subsalicylate
Bismuth subsalicylate.description: A gastrointestinal medication that coats the stomach and reduces nausea, diarrhea, and indigestion.

Calcium carbonate.name: Calcium carbonate
Calcium carbonate.description: An antacid that neutralizes excess stomach acid to relieve heartburn and indigestion.

Omeprazole.name: Omeprazole
Omeprazole.description: A proton pump inhibitor that reduces stomach acid production for long-term reflux management.

Fluoxetine.name: Fluoxetine
Fluoxetine.description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression, OCD, panic disorder, and bulimia by increasing serotonin levels.

Sertraline.name: Sertraline
Sertraline.description: An SSRI medication used to treat depression and anxiety by stabilizing serotonin activity.

Escitalopram.name: Escitalopram
Escitalopram.description: Escitalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression and generalized anxiety disorder by increasing serotonin levels.

Alprazolam.name: Alprazolam
Alprazolam.description: A fast-acting benzodiazepine that reduces anxiety by enhancing calming neurotransmitter effects.

Lorazepam.name: Lorazepam
Lorazepam.description: A benzodiazepine sedative used for anxiety and insomnia by slowing brain activity.

Amphetamine salts.name: Amphetamine salts
Amphetamine salts.description: Central nervous system stimulants that increase focus, attention, and alertness.

Methylphenidate.name: Methylphenidate
Methylphenidate.description: A stimulant medication that improves attention and impulse control in ADHD patients.

Gabapentin.name: Gabapentin
Gabapentin.description: An anticonvulsant medication that reduces nerve pain by calming abnormal electrical brain activity.

Pregabalin.name: Pregabalin
Pregabalin.description: A nerve pain medication that reduces overactive nerve signaling associated with chronic pain conditions.

Tramadol.name: Tramadol
Tramadol.description: An opioid-like pain medication that alters pain perception within the central nervous system.

Melatonin.name: Melatonin
Melatonin.description: A natural hormone that regulates circadian rhythm and promotes healthy sleep cycles.

Zolpidem.name: Zolpidem
Zolpidem.description: A sedative-hypnotic medication that helps initiate sleep by acting on GABA receptors.

Loperamide.name: Loperamide
Loperamide.description: An anti-diarrheal medication that slows intestinal movement to reduce stool frequency.

Polyethylene glycol 3350.name: Polyethylene glycol 3350
Polyethylene glycol 3350.description: An osmotic laxative that draws water into stool to ease bowel movements.

Bisacodyl.name: Bisacodyl
Bisacodyl.description: A stimulant laxative that increases bowel contractions to relieve constipation.

Docusate sodium.name: Docusate sodium
Docusate sodium.description: A stool softener that allows water to penetrate stool for easier passage.

Senna.name: Senna
Senna.description: A plant-derived stimulant laxative that promotes bowel movements by irritating intestinal lining.

Psyllium husk.name: Psyllium husk
Psyllium husk.description: A soluble fiber supplement that adds bulk to stool and improves bowel regularity.

Magnesium hydroxide.name: Magnesium hydroxide
Magnesium hydroxide.description: An osmotic laxative and antacid that softens stool and neutralizes stomach acid.

Linaclotide.name: Linaclotide
Linaclotide.description: A medication that increases intestinal fluid secretion to relieve chronic constipation.

Lubiprostone.name: Lubiprostone
Lubiprostone.description: A chloride channel activator that improves stool passage in chronic constipation.

Plecanatide.name: Plecanatide
Plecanatide.description: A guanylate cyclase-C agonist that increases fluid secretion in the intestines.

Lactulose.name: Lactulose
Lactulose.description: A synthetic sugar laxative that draws water into the bowel to soften stools.

Ashwagandha.name: Ashwagandha
Ashwagandha.description: An adaptogenic herb traditionally used to help the body manage stress and anxiety.

Azithromycin.name: Azithromycin
Azithromycin.description: A macrolide antibiotic that treats bacterial infections by inhibiting protein synthesis.

Loquat.name: Loquat
Loquat.description: A fruit used in traditional medicine to soothe throat irritation and suppress cough.

Camphor.name: Camphor
Camphor.description: A topical compound that produces a warming sensation and relieves muscle pain.

Menthol.name: Menthol
Menthol.description: A cooling agent that provides pain relief and soothing sensations on the skin.

Cajuput Oil.name: Cajuput oil
Cajuput Oil.description: An essential oil with antiseptic and analgesic properties used in topical pain relief.

Dementholised Mint Oil.name: Dementholised Mint Oil
Dementholised Mint Oil.description: A refined mint oil that delivers cooling relief without excessive menthol intensity.

Clove Oil.name: Clove Oil
Clove Oil.description: An essential oil known for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects.

Morphine sulfate.name: Morphine sulfate
Morphine sulfate.description: A potent opioid analgesic used to manage severe pain by acting on opioid receptors.

Acetylsalicylic acid.name: Acetylsalicylic acid
Acetylsalicylic acid.description: Used for pain relief, fever reduction, and anti-inflammatory purposes; also has antiplatelet effects reducing blood clot formation.

Xylometazoline hydrochloride.name: Xylometazoline hydrochloride
Xylometazoline hydrochloride.description: A nasal decongestant that narrows blood vessels in the nose, reducing swelling and congestion due to colds or allergies.

Pseudoephedrine HCl.name: Pseudoephedrine HCl
Pseudoephedrine HCl.description: A nasal decongestant that reduces swelling of nasal passages, making it easier to breathe through the nose.

Ashwagandha extract.name: Ashwagandha extract
Ashwagandha extract.description: Helps the body to cope with stress and anxiety and supports memory and cognitive function.

Ashwagandha root.name: Ashwagandha root
Ashwagandha root.description: Used in traditional medicine; may reduce stress and fatigue.

Fruit juice.name: Fruit juice
Fruit juice.description: Liquid from fruits, consumed for nutritional value and hydration.

Methylphenidate hydrochloride.name: Methylphenidate hydrochloride
Methylphenidate hydrochloride.description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy by affecting neurotransmitters in the brain.

Ciprofloxacin.name: Ciprofloxacin
Ciprofloxacin.description: A quinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, preventing bacterial growth and spread in the affected area.

Dexamethasone.name: Dexamethasone
Dexamethasone.description: A corticosteroid that reduces inflammation and suppresses the immune system, decreasing swelling and discomfort in the ear.

Vitamin B.name: Vitamin B
Vitamin B.description: A group of essential nutrients that play many important roles in your body's overall health.

Vitamin C.name: Vitamin C
Vitamin C.description: An antioxidant that supports immune function and is important for collagen production and wound healing.

Vitamin D.name: Vitamin D
Vitamin D.description: A fat-soluble vitamin that promotes calcium absorption and bone health and supports immune function.

Alcohol.name: Alcohol
Alcohol.description: Used as a solvent for fragrance oils and can also have a temporary skin-cooling effect.

Fragrance.name: Fragrance
Fragrance.description: Provides the scent of the product, a combination of various aromatic compounds and essential oils.

Water.name: Water
Water.description: Used as a solvent to dissolve and mix other ingredients, and acts as a diluent.

Semaglutide.name: Semaglutide
Semaglutide.description: A glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist used to treat type 2 diabetes and promote weight loss.

Tacrolimus.name: Tacrolimus
Tacrolimus.description: An immunosuppressant drug used to treat atopic dermatitis and prevent organ rejection after transplant.

Nausea.name: Nausea
Nausea.description: A feeling of sickness with an inclination to vomit.

Dizziness.name: Dizziness
Dizziness.description: A sensation of spinning around and losing one's balance.

Stomach upset.name: Stomach upset
Stomach upset.description: General term for digestive issues like nausea, bloating, or discomfort in the stomach area due to various causes.

Heartburn.name: Heartburn
Heartburn.description: A burning sensation in the chest, caused by acid reflux.

Drowsiness.name: Drowsiness
Drowsiness.description: Feeling sleepy or having difficulty staying awake.

Dry mouth.name: Dry mouth
Dry mouth.description: Dry mouth, also known as xerostomia, is a condition where the salivary glands do not produce enough saliva.

Insomnia.name: Insomnia
Insomnia.description: Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep, can be a side effect of certain medications.

Rash.name: Rash
Rash.description: A skin eruption, typically red and itchy, often caused by allergic reactions or infections on skin.

Fever.name: Fever
Fever.description: A body temperature that is higher than normal (usually above 98.6°F or 37°C).

Pain.name: Pain
Pain.description: A physical suffering or discomfort caused by illness or injury.

Inflammation.name: Inflammation
Inflammation.description: The body's response to injury or infection, characterized by swelling, redness, and discomfort in the ear.

Allergies.name: Allergies
Allergies.description: A condition caused by hypersensitivity of the immune system to typically harmless substances in the environment.

Cough.name: Cough
Cough.description: A reflex action to clear the airways of mucus, irritants, or foreign particles for respiration system.

Nasal congestion.name: Nasal congestion
Nasal congestion.description: Blockage of the nasal passages, usually due to swollen membranes from infection or allergies.

Chest congestion.name: Chest congestion
Chest congestion.description: Mucus accumulation in the lungs or airways that makes breathing and coughing difficult.

Acid reflux.name: Acid reflux
Acid reflux.description: A digestive condition where stomach acid flows backward into the esophagus, causing irritation.

Itchy eyes.name: Itchy eyes
Itchy eyes.description: Eye irritation characterized by itching, redness, watering, and discomfort, commonly due to allergies.

Sinus pressure.name: Sinus pressure
Sinus pressure.description: A feeling of fullness or pain in the sinuses due to inflammation or congestion.

Upset stomach.name: Upset stomach
Upset stomach.description: General digestive discomfort including nausea, bloating, cramping, or indigestion.

Diarrhea.name: Diarrhea
Diarrhea.description: Condition of having frequent, liquid bowel movements, a common side effect.

Constipation.name: Constipation
Constipation.description: Difficulty in emptying the bowels, usually associated with hardened feces.

Dark stools.name: Dark stools
Dark stools.description: Darkened stool color caused by medication interactions, commonly harmless but sometimes alarming.

Anxiety.name: Anxiety
Anxiety.description: A feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.

Depression.name: Depression
Depression.description: A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.

Brain fog.name: Brain fog
Brain fog.description: Reduced mental clarity characterized by forgetfulness, slowed thinking, and difficulty concentrating.

Memory loss.name: Memory loss
Memory loss.description: Difficulty remembering things that happened recently or long ago, impacting daily life and functions.

Hallucinations.name: Hallucinations
Hallucinations.description: Perceiving sights, sounds, or sensations that are not present in reality.

Seizures.name: Seizures
Seizures.description: Sudden abnormal electrical activity in the brain causing convulsions or altered consciousness.

Weight gain.name: Weight gain
Weight gain.description: An increase in body weight due to metabolic changes, increased appetite, or fluid retention.

Appetite loss.name: Appetite loss
Appetite loss.description: Reduced desire to eat, which may lead to unintended weight loss and nutritional imbalance.

Emotional blunting.name: Emotional blunting
Emotional blunting.description: Diminished emotional responsiveness resulting in muted feelings of joy, sadness, or excitement.

Sexual dysfunction.name: Sexual dysfunction
Sexual dysfunction.description: Problems with sexual desire, arousal, or orgasm, potentially caused by certain medications' side effects.

OCD.name: OCD
OCD.description: A mental health disorder involving intrusive thoughts and repetitive behaviors performed to reduce anxiety.

PTSD.name: PTSD
PTSD.description: A condition triggered by traumatic events, causing flashbacks, anxiety, and emotional distress.

Panic attacks.name: Panic attacks
Panic attacks.description: Sudden episodes of intense fear accompanied by physical symptoms such as chest pain and shortness of breath.

ADHD.name: ADHD
ADHD.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity, typically diagnosed in childhood. Medications can help.

Narcolepsy.name: Narcolepsy
Narcolepsy.description: A chronic sleep disorder involving excessive daytime sleepiness and sudden sleep episodes.

Nerve pain.name: Nerve pain
Nerve pain.description: Pain resulting from nerve damage, often described as burning, tingling, or shooting sensations.

Fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
Fibromyalgia.description: A chronic condition causing widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, and heightened pain sensitivity.

Moderate pain.name: Moderate pain
Moderate pain.description: Pain that is noticeable and uncomfortable but not completely disabling.

Sleep disturbance.name: Sleep disturbance
Sleep disturbance.description: Disruption of normal sleep patterns including difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep.

Dependence.name: Dependence
Dependence.description: Physical or psychological reliance on a substance, often accompanied by withdrawal symptoms.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description: A mental state involving disorientation, difficulty thinking clearly, and impaired awareness.

Sedation.name: Sedation
Sedation.description: A calming or sleep-inducing effect that reduces alertness and physical activity.

Agitation.name: Agitation
Agitation.description: A state of restlessness or irritability often accompanied by increased physical or emotional tension.

Fatigue.name: Fatigue
Fatigue.description: A feeling of tiredness or lack of energy.

Irritability.name: Irritability
Irritability.description: Increased sensitivity to frustration resulting in impatience or anger.

Increased heart rate.name: Increased heart rate
Increased heart rate.description: A faster-than-normal heartbeat that may cause palpitations or feelings of nervousness.

Nervousness.name: Nervousness
Nervousness.description: A state of anxiety or unease, often characterized by restlessness, rapid heart rate, and difficulty concentrating. Can be caused by stimulants.

Edema.name: Edema
Edema.description: Swelling caused by fluid retention, commonly affecting the legs, feet, or hands.

Vivid dreams.name: Vivid dreams
Vivid dreams.description: Unusually intense, detailed, or memorable dreams that occur during sleep.

Sleepwalking.name: Sleepwalking
Sleepwalking.description: Performing activities while asleep with little or no memory of the event.

Memory gaps.name: Memory gaps
Memory gaps.description: Periods of missing memory where events cannot be recalled afterward.

Stress.name: Stress
Stress.description: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances.

Infections.name: Infections
Infections.description: Illnesses caused by harmful microorganisms entering and multiplying within the body.

Germs.name: Germs
Germs.description: Microorganisms such as bacteria and viruses that can cause disease.

Loss of Appetite.name: Loss of appetite
Loss of Appetite.description: Reduced desire to eat, potentially linked to medication side effects or underlying medical conditions.

Bacterial infections.name: Bacterial infections
Bacterial infections.description: Infections caused by bacteria that may affect various body systems.

Impaired sense of taste.name: Impaired sense of taste
Impaired sense of taste.description: Reduced or altered ability to perceive flavors while eating or drinking.

Increased blood sugar.name: Increased blood sugar
Increased blood sugar.description: Elevated glucose levels in the bloodstream, potentially affecting metabolic health.

Sore throat.name: Sore throat
Sore throat.description: Pain or irritation in the throat, often caused by viral or bacterial infections; can make swallowing painful.

Allergic reaction in some individuals.name: Allergic reaction in some individuals
Allergic reaction in some individuals.description: An immune response to a substance causing symptoms such as itching, swelling, or breathing difficulty.

Minor skin wounds.name: Minor skin wounds
Minor skin wounds.description: Small cuts, scrapes, or abrasions affecting the outer layer of skin.

Skin irritation.name: Skin irritation
Skin irritation.description: Redness, itching, or burning sensation on the skin caused by ingredients in the product.

Redness.name: Redness
Redness.description: Visible reddening of the skin due to increased blood flow or irritation.

Itching.name: Itching
Itching.description: An uncomfortable sensation on the skin that causes the urge to scratch.

Muscle pain.name: Muscle pain
Muscle pain.description: Aches and soreness in muscles, ranging from mild discomfort to severe pain.

Joint pain.name: Joint pain
Joint pain.description: Discomfort, aching, or soreness in one or more joints, often caused by arthritis or injury.

Insect bites.name: Insect bites
Insect bites.description: Skin reactions caused by insect stings or bites, often resulting in itching and swelling.

Burning sensation.name: Burning sensation
Burning sensation.description: A feeling of heat or stinging on the skin following topical application.

Respiratory depression.name: Respiratory depression
Respiratory depression.description: Slowed or shallow breathing that can be dangerous and requires medical attention.

Lightheadedness.name: Lightheadedness
Lightheadedness.description: A faint or woozy sensation that may occur when standing or moving suddenly.

Vomiting.name: Vomiting
Vomiting.description: The forceful expulsion of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.

Increased bleeding risk.name: Increased bleeding risk
Increased bleeding risk.description: Elevated chance of bleeding more easily or excessively due to impaired blood clotting mechanisms.

Stomach pain.name: Stomach pain
Stomach pain.description: Discomfort or ache in the abdomen, can be caused by certain medications.

Increased blood pressure.name: Increased blood pressure
Increased blood pressure.description: A condition where the force of blood against artery walls is too high, potentially leading to health issues.

Migraine.name: Migraine
Migraine.description: A type of headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation.

Migraines.name: Migraines
Migraines.description: A type of headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation.

Hay fever.name: Hay fever
Hay fever.description: Allergic rhinitis caused by pollen, leading to sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes, and congestion symptoms.

Itchy skin.name: Itchy skin
Itchy skin.description: An uncomfortable sensation leading to the urge to scratch, often caused by allergies or skin conditions.

Sneezing.name: Sneezing
Sneezing.description: Sneezing is a sudden, forceful expulsion of air through the nose and mouth, usually caused by irritation of the nasal passages.

Runny nose.name: Runny nose
Runny nose.description: A runny nose is when the nasal passages drain, resulting in nasal discharge. This can be due to allergies.

Burning.name: Burning
Burning.description: A painful sensation similar to being scorched, potentially occurring in the nasal passages after nasal spray application.

Stinging.name: Stinging
Stinging.description: Sharp, pricking or burning sensation that can occur in the nasal passages after using certain nasal sprays.

Dryness.name: Dryness
Dryness.description: A lack of moisture, often experienced in the nasal passages after using decongestants.

Cold.name: Cold
Cold.description: A common viral infection causing inflammation of the nose and throat, leading to symptoms such as runny nose.

Nasal dryness.name: Nasal dryness
Nasal dryness.description: A condition where the nasal passages lack sufficient moisture, leading to discomfort and potential irritation inside the nose.

Common cold.name: Common cold
Common cold.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract that causes symptoms such as a runny nose and congestion.

Muscle aches.name: Muscle aches
Muscle aches.description: Muscle aches and pains are discomfort in one or more muscles or groups of muscles.

Liver damage.name: Liver damage
Liver damage.description: Liver damage refers to injury or disease affecting the liver and its ability to function properly.

Allergic reaction.name: Allergic reaction
Allergic reaction.description: Immune system response causing rash, hives, swelling, or difficulty breathing upon exposure.

Sinus congestion.name: Sinus congestion
Sinus congestion.description: Blockage of the nasal passages usually due to membranes lining the nose becoming swollen from inflamed blood vessels.

Difficulty sleeping.name: Difficulty sleeping
Difficulty sleeping.description: Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep, which can lead to fatigue and other health issues.

Sinus pain.name: Sinus Pain
Sinus pain.description: Discomfort or aching in the sinus cavities of the face, often caused by inflammation or infection.

Sinus pain and pressure.name: Sinus pain and pressure
Sinus pain and pressure.description: Sinus pain is discomfort in the sinuses, which are air-filled cavities in the skull, usually associated with inflammation.

Muscle & Joint Pain.name: Muscle & Joint Pain
Muscle & Joint Pain.description: Aching or soreness in muscles and joints, often caused by overuse, injury, or underlying medical conditions.

Memory impairment.name: Memory impairment
Memory impairment.description: Difficulty in remembering things; can be caused by aging or other medical conditions.

Memory problems.name: Memory problems
Memory problems.description: Difficulties with recalling information, remembering recent events, or forming new memories. It can impact daily life.

Dehydration.name: Dehydration
Dehydration.description: Occurs when you use or lose more fluid than you take in.

Decreased appetite.name: Decreased appetite
Decreased appetite.description: A reduction in the desire to eat, potentially leading to weight loss or nutritional deficiencies. Stimulants can cause this.

Ear discomfort.name: Ear discomfort
Ear discomfort.description: Mild pain or discomfort within the ear, often a temporary reaction to medication use.

Irritation.name: Irritation
Irritation.description: Redness and swelling around the ear canal, indicating mild inflammation or adverse reaction.

Taste alteration.name: Taste alteration
Taste alteration.description: Change in the sense of taste, possibly metallic or bitter, often temporary after medication application.

Outer ear infections.name: Outer ear infections
Outer ear infections.description: Infection of the external ear canal caused by bacteria or fungi. Treated with antibiotics/antifungals.

Swimmer's ear.name: Swimmer's ear
Swimmer's ear.description: Infection of the outer ear canal, often caused by moisture. Antibiotics can treat bacterial infections.

Congestion.name: Congestion
Congestion.description: The blockage of nasal passages which makes it difficult to breathe through the nose, common during illness.

Body aches.name: Body aches
Body aches.description: Widespread muscle pain or discomfort throughout the body, often associated with illness or overexertion in body.

Nutrient deficiency.name: Nutrient deficiency
Nutrient deficiency.description: A condition resulting from insufficient intake or absorption of essential nutrients, leading to health problems.

Weight changes.name: Weight changes
Weight changes.description: Increase or decrease in body weight, caused by medication altering appetite or metabolism.

Obsessive-compulsive disorder.name: Obsessive-compulsive disorder
Obsessive-compulsive disorder.description: A disorder in which a person has uncontrollable, reoccurring thoughts (obsessions) and behaviors (compulsions).

Panic disorder.name: Panic disorder
Panic disorder.description: An anxiety disorder characterized by unexpected and repeated episodes of intense fear accompanied by physical symptoms.

Bulimia.name: Bulimia
Bulimia.description: A serious eating disorder marked by bingeing, followed by methods to avoid weight gain like purging.

Abdominal pain.name: Abdominal pain
Abdominal pain.description: Pain or discomfort felt in the abdomen area, can be a side effect.

Type 2 Diabetes.name: Type 2 Diabetes
Type 2 Diabetes.description: A chronic metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels.

Skin burning sensation.name: Skin burning sensation
Skin burning sensation.description: An uncomfortable and painful feeling of heat or burning on the skin's surface.

Skin redness.name: Skin redness
Skin redness.description: Abnormal reddening of the skin, often due to inflammation or irritation.

Acne.name: Acne
Acne.description: A skin condition characterized by pimples, blackheads, and inflammation.

Atopic dermatitis.name: Atopic dermatitis
Atopic dermatitis.description: A chronic inflammatory skin condition that causes dry, itchy, and inflamed skin.
